verses.verse: Then answered<WH6030> Zophar<WH6691> the Naamathite<WH5284>, and said<WH559>,
Therefore do my thoughts<WH5587> give answer<WH7725> to me<WH2363>, Even by reason of my haste that is in me.
I have heard<WH8085> the reproof<WH4148> which putteth me to shame<WH3639>; And the spirit<WH7307> of my understanding<WH998> answereth me<WH6030>.
Knowest <WH3045> thou not this of old<WH5703> time<WH120>, Since man was placed<WH7760> upon earth<WH776>,
That the triumphing<WH7445> of the wicked<WH7563> is short<WH7138>, And the joy<WH8057> of the godless<WH2611> but for a moment<WH7281>?
Though his height<WH7863> mount up<WH5927> to the heavens<WH8064>, And his head<WH7218> reach<WH5060> unto the clouds<WH5645>;
Yet he shall perish<WH6> for ever<WH5331> like his own dung<WH1561>: They that have seen<WH7200> him shall say<WH559>, Where is he<WH335>?
He shall fly away<WH5774> as a dream<WH2472>, and shall not be found<WH4672>: Yea<WH5074>, he shall be chased away as a vision<WH2384> of the night<WH3915>.
The eye<WH5869> which saw<WH7805> him shall see him no more<WH3254>; Neither shall his place<WH4725> any more behold him<WH7789>.
His children<WH1121> shall seek the favor<WH7521> of the poor<WH1800>, And his hands<WH3027> shall give back<WH7725> his wealth<WH202>.
His bones<WH6106> are full<WH4390> of his youth<WH5934>, But it shall lie down<WH7901> with him in the dust<WH6083>.
Though wickedness<WH7451> be sweet<WH4985> in his mouth<WH6310>, Though he hide<WH3582> it under his tongue<WH3956>,
Though he spare<WH2550> it<WH5800>, and will not let it go, But keep it still<WH4513> within<WH8432> his mouth<WH2441>;
Yet his food<WH3899> in his bowels<WH4578> is turned<WH2015>, It is the gall<WH4846> of asps<WH6620> within him<WH7130>.
He hath swallowed down<WH1104> riches<WH2428>, and he shall vomit them up again<WH6958>; God<WH410> will cast them out<WH3423> of his belly<WH990>.
He shall suck<WH3243> the poison<WH7219> of asps<WH6620>: The viper<WH660>'s tongue<WH3956> shall slay him<WH2026>.
He shall not look<WH7200> upon the rivers<WH6390>, The flowing<WH5104> streams<WH6390> of honey<WH1706> and butter<WH2529>.
That which he labored<WH3022> for shall he restore<WH7725>, and shall not swallow it down<WH1104>; According to the substance<WH2428> that he hath gotten<WH8545>, he shall not rejoice<WH5965>.
For he hath oppressed<WH7533> and forsaken<WH5800> the poor<WH1800>; He hath violently taken away<WH1497> a house<WH1004>, and he shall not build it up<WH1129>.
Because he knew<WH3045> no quietness<WH7961> within him<WH990>, He shall not save<WH4422> aught of that wherein he delighteth<WH2530>.
There was nothing<WH400> left<WH8300> that he devoured not<WH2898>; Therefore his prosperity shall not endure<WH2342>.
In the fulness<WH4390> of his sufficiency<WH5607> he shall be in straits<WH3334>: The hand<WH3027> of every one that is in misery<WH6001> shall come upon him<WH935>.
When he is about to fill<WH4390> his belly<WH990>, God will cast<WH7971> the fierceness<WH2740> of his wrath<WH639> upon him<WH4305>, And will rain it upon him while he is eating<WH3894>.
He shall flee<WH1272> from the iron<WH1270> weapon<WH5402>, And the bow<WH7198> of brass<WH5154> shall strike him through<WH2498>.
He draweth<WH8025> it forth<WH3318>, and it cometh out of his body<WH1465>; Yea<WH1300>, the glittering point cometh out<WH1980> of his gall<WH4846>: Terrors are upon him<WH367>.

All darkness<WH2822> is laid<WH2934> up for his treasures<WH6845>: A fire<WH784> not blown<WH5301> by man shall devour<WH398> him<WH3415>; It shall consume that which is left<WH8300> in his tent<WH168>.
The heavens<WH8064> shall reveal<WH1540> his iniquity<WH5771>, And the earth<WH776> shall rise up against him<WH6965>.
The increase<WH2981> of his house<WH1004> shall depart<WH1540>; His goods shall flow away<WH5064> in the day<WH3117> of his wrath<WH639>.
This is the portion<WH2506> of a wicked<WH7563> man<WH120> from God<WH430>, And the heritage<WH5159> appointed<WH561> unto him by God<WH410>.
